info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 5 at 12:50AM EDT until May 5 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Binghamton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...The west branch of the Lackawaxen is now at 6.46 feet. Flood stage is 6.5 feet or slightly higher level at Aldenville. The gauge will likely rise over the flood stage of 6.5 feet for a time early this morning.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Wayne.
* WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 AM EDT, Flooding is likely to occur soon at Aldenville along with the west branch of the Lackawaxen with the current value as of 12:30 AM of 6.46 feet just under flood stage of 6.5 feet. Rises to and just above 6.5 feet are likely to occur for a few hours early this morning. - Flooding impacts will occur, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waymart, Prompton, Bethany, Pleasant Mount, Aldenville and Prompton State Park. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
